kabasuji.model

Class Piece

  • java.lang.Object
    • kabasuji.model.Piece
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Piece
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    this class stores all data relevant to pieces, such as their shape it also contains all the logic for rotating and flipping pieces
    Author:
    Ethan
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Piece(Tile[][] t)
      this constructor creates a piece based on the contents of a matrix of tiles

      • Piece

        public Piece(Tile[][] t)
        this constructor creates a piece based on the contents of a matrix of tiles
        Parameters:
        t - the matrix of tiles that becomes the pieces shape

    • Method Detail

      • rotate

        public void rotate(boolean right)
        rotates the piece 90 degrees in the direction specified
        Parameters:
        right - a boolean that if true, the piece is rotated right and if false, the piece rotates left

      • flip

        public void flip(boolean vertical)
        this method flips the piece
        Parameters:
        vertical - if true the piece is flipped vertically and if false the pieces if flipped horizontally

      • getTile

        public Tile getTile(int y,
                    int x)
        this method returns the tile at a specified location in the matrix
        Parameters:
        y - the row of the tile
        x - the column of the tile
        Returns:
        the tile at the specified row and column

      • getDim

        public int getDim()
        returns the dimension of the piece
        Returns:
        an int that is the number of rows and columns in the piece matrix

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Piece p)
        determines whether two pieces are the same shape
        Parameters:
        p - the piece that this piece is compared to
        Returns:
        boolean that is true if the pieces are the same shape

        public java.awt.Point findReferencePoint()
